In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

You can use the built-in `Dates` library in Julia to do this. The function `Year(dt)` gives you just the year part of `dt`, and similarly for months `Month(dt)`. Then, you concatenate these into a string and parse it as an integer. Here's how to do it:

```julia
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [string(Year(t), Month(t)) for t in df[:dt]]
end
```
This function adds a new column `ym` to the DataFrame, where each entry is the year and month from corresponding DateTime entry in `dt`. Note that you need to ensure `df` contains a DateTime column called `:dt`.
